name: UK Politicians' Nicknames Online Trivia | Government | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is Paddy Ashdown's real firstname?
questions.explanation:
Jeremy.

	He was nicknamed Paddy at school because of his (then) Ulster accent.

questions.text: Which grandee was nicknamed the Duke of Burgundy?
questions.explanation:
Roy Jenkins.

	Roy Jenkins acquired the nickname during his time as a European Commissioner and for his love of fine wine.

Michael Heseltine.

	The flamboyant Michael Heseltine once seized the parliamentary Mace in breach of protocol. He walked out of Margaret Thatcher's cabinet on camera and later challenged her for the leadership of the Conservative party.

questions.text: Who is the Beast of Bolsover?
questions.explanation:
Dennis Skinner.

	Dennis Skinner, veteran Labour MP for Bolsover in Derbyshire, chooses to sit with the Liberal Democrats so that he can abuse his own side in Parliament.

questions.text: Which party leader was called the Welsh Wizard?
questions.explanation:
David Lloyd George.

	David Lloyd George was famous for his oratory as well as his social reforms and colourful private life.

questions.text: Who was less kindly known as the Welsh Windbag?
questions.explanation:
Neil Kinnock.

	Neil Kinnock was the Labour leader who set in train reforms during the 1980s but never became Prime Minister.

questions.text: Who chose not to be known as Viscount Stansgate?
questions.explanation:
Tony Benn.

	Tony Benn, full name Anthony Wedgwood Benn, abdicated his inherited peerage in order to remain a Labour MP.

questions.text: Who founded the Monster Raving Loony Party?
questions.explanation:
Lord Sutch.

	He stood for elections as Lord David Sutch, and financed his political career with his rock performances as Screaming Lord Sutch.

questions.text: Which cartoon character was an early nickname for Prime Minister Tony Blair?
questions.explanation:
Bambi.

	Presumably Bambi because of his apparently innocent smile?
